dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General is bowed on the turf, his wife has rushed to Sunhill, stricken, turns from him as the shouting rises p her. Brenner is sprinting up through the midst of the cro his badge held high. She runs toward him.

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: Fowler’s gone! Brenner and Sunhill desperately scan the field, swarming with soldiers, many armed and ready to shoot. A group of pound toward them, pistols out. Brenner raises his badge bellowing hoarsely.

dialogues.speaker: CID
dialogues.text: Another wave of shouts and cries fills the air. Brenner a Sunhill pivot, see a flurry of commotion, a crowd rushing an area ahead of them. They take off at a dead run, both quickly closing ground the fringes of the throng, soldiers and civilians pushing toward something. They reach the edge of a human wall, jump in, tearing a p

dialogues.speaker: CID
dialogues.text: They fight their way through the close pack of bodies, Br ramming forward, yelling raggedly. The crowd gives, they out into an open circle of lawn, bringing themselves up s panting, staring ahead. Colonel Fowler stands in a clearing ringed by shocked sol and civilians, saber drawn, an MP, arm slashed, lying pal still on the grass below him, his pistol under Fowler's s

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Give it up, Colonel. Fowler, face stone, eyes black, stares at him, past reaso redemption. Several soldiers make a move toward him, he c the air with his steel, growling, they leap back as the c shouts out.  119 He glares savagely at Brenner, swinging his blade in a ci the sun gleaming off the razor-honed edge of it. He advan Brenner and Sunhill drop down defensively, level their we as the ring of onlookers fall back.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Halt! Fowler raises the blade over his head. The blast of a gun splits the air, a row of medals exploding off his chest. Colonel lurches, topples face forward, dead as he hits gr The agents, frozen in a crouch, stare in astonishment, we unfired. The crowd stunned, silent, parting across the ci of the clearing, leaving one man standing alone. General Campbell. His officer’s Beretta in his hand, feat terrible, eyes hollow. He lowers his gun. It slips from his fingers. Pandemonium

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot Georgia sky. Shadeless lawn. Chanting. A file of youn head-shaven recruits moving in step-time along the road, drill sergeant dogging them. Sunhill's Mustang, one flank scraped and battered, drives them, moving toward the main gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands outside her car, shading her eyes. Brenner’s p up approaches. The truck stops, he gets out, crosses the to her. They stand facing each other, glad to see each other, sor may be the last time.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: So you're really out.

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: It had to be that way. Brenner nods, understanding. She gazes at him, regretfull

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: What happens to you?  120

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: I’m not sure... They can't decide whether to give me a medal or hang me. Maybe I‘1ll just cash out.

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: You're a lifer, Brenner.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess I am. They smile, their attraction to each other seen in their

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: Am I ever gonna see you again?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Just let me know where you are. Their smiles fade. They stand close to each other, wantin embrace. Instead, he extends his hand, in respect. Her ey hold her own regard, sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: Thank you. For everything. Their handshake lingers. Sunhill turns, her eyes damp, en her car. He leans over her window. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: I turned a corner in my life... My father. The General. Fowler. The Army, what it stands for... they all got it wrong. Brenner stares at her, somber.

dialogues.speaker: SUNHILL
dialogues.text: Who really killed her, Brenner?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER
dialogues.text: Everybody. Their gaze lasts a moment more. She smiles a plaintive sm a look of goodbye. Then she starts the car, turning her e to the future. Brenner remains there, watching her pull out, her car dra away on the road, receding.
